snippet: Many semiconductor companies have low profit margins or are losing money while huge Silicon Valley businesses that depend on innovations in the chip industry are flush with profits.
abstract: Taiwan is world's biggest chip maker, with $63 billion in 2012 sales, but many semiconductor companies have low profit margins or are losing money; at same time, Silicon Valley giants that depend on innovations in chip industry are flush with profits.
lead_paragraph: Many semiconductor companies have low profit margins or are losing money while huge Silicon Valley businesses that depend on innovations in the chip industry are flush with profits.

headline.main: Taiwan Chip Industry Powers the Tech World, but Struggles for Status
headline.print_headline: Taiwan Chip Industry Powers the Tech World, but Struggles for Status
